prior_works.title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
prior_works.authors: Andreas Rombach, Robin Blattmann, Dominik Lorenz, Patrick Esser, Björn Ommer
prior_works.role: Generative backbone enabling efficient, high-fidelity image synthesis and latent-space guidance
prior_works.relationship_sentence: BrainDiVE relies on a pretrained latent diffusion model in the style of LDMs to provide scalable, photorealistic image generation that can be steered by brain-derived objectives.

prior_works.title: Classifier-Free Diffusion Guidance
prior_works.role: Guidance mechanism for diffusion sampling using an external, differentiable objective
prior_works.relationship_sentence: BrainDiVE adapts the principle of guidance in diffusion—replacing a classifier/text signal with a brain-encoding objective—so the sampler follows gradients that increase predicted ROI activation.

prior_works.title: High-Resolution Image Reconstruction with Latent Diffusion Models from Human Brain Activity
prior_works.role: Direct precedent for coupling fMRI with latent diffusion models
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrates that fMRI-derived signals can condition LDMs to reconstruct perceived images; BrainDiVE extends this by optimizing for targeted cortical activations rather than reconstructing specific stimuli.

prior_works.title: Deep Image Reconstruction from Human Brain Activity
prior_works.authors: Guohua Shen, Tomoyasu Horikawa, Kei Majima, Yukiyasu Kamitani
prior_works.role: Pioneering fMRI-to-image reconstruction using deep generative priors
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Introduces the paradigm of using deep generative models with brain activity, which BrainDiVE generalizes from reconstruction to exploration by synthesizing images predicted to activate specific ROIs.

prior_works.title: Neural Population Control via Deep Image Synthesis
prior_works.authors: Arash Bashivan, Kohitij Kar, James J. DiCarlo
prior_works.role: Closed-loop optimization of generative models to maximize neural responses
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Establishes brain-guided stimulus synthesis to drive neuronal populations; BrainDiVE transfers this concept to human fMRI and modern diffusion models to probe cortical organization.

prior_works.title: Synthesizing the Preferred Inputs for Neurons in Neural Networks via Deep Generator Networks
prior_works.authors: Anh Nguyen, Alexey Dosovitskiy, Jason Yosinski
prior_works.role: Activation maximization with a generator for interpretable stimulus synthesis
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provides the key technique of optimizing within a generator to produce stimuli that maximize a response function, which BrainDiVE repurposes with a brain-encoding objective and diffusion backbone.

prior_works.title: The Natural Scenes Dataset (NSD): A major 7T fMRI resource for studying naturalistic vision
prior_works.authors: E. J. Allen, G. St-Yves, Y. Wu, J. L. Breedlove, J. S. Prince, L. T. Dowdle, et al.
prior_works.role: Large-scale paired images–fMRI dataset enabling high-capacity encoding models
prior_works.relationship_sentence: BrainDiVE trains robust image-to-brain encoding models on NSD, whose scale and naturalistic diversity are essential for reliable brain-guided diffusion synthesis.

synthesis_narrative: BrainDiVE’s core innovation—using brain-guided diffusion to synthesize images predicted to activate specific cortical regions—emerges at the intersection of three lines of work. First, deep generative priors for fMRI, inaugurated by Shen et al., showed that brain activity can steer image generators to reconstruct percepts. Takagi and Nishimoto advanced this with latent diffusion models (LDMs), proving that modern diffusion backbones and latent conditioning are effective for high-fidelity, brain-conditioned synthesis. Second, activation-maximization with generators (Nguyen et al.) and closed-loop brain-guided stimulus optimization for neuronal populations (Bashivan et al.) established the methodological blueprint for optimizing images to maximize neural responses, which BrainDiVE extends from single-unit electrophysiology and GANs to population-level human fMRI and diffusion models. Third, LDMs (Rombach et al.) and guidance strategies for diffusion sampling (Ho & Salimans) provide the scalable, controllable generative substrate; BrainDiVE replaces standard text/classifier signals with a differentiable brain-encoding objective, effectively turning ROI activation predictions into a guidance signal during sampling. Crucially, the Natural Scenes Dataset (Allen et al.) supplies the large, naturalistic paired image–fMRI data needed to train strong encoding models whose gradients are reliable enough to direct diffusion. Together, these works directly inform BrainDiVE’s design: an encoding model trained on NSD predicts ROI responses; its gradients guide an LDM via classifier-free-like guidance to synthesize images that explore and reveal fine-grained functional organization without hand-curated categorical stimuli.
